Title: Data Analyst
Description:
This position is responsible for supporting North American Maintenance & Engineering by creating, updating, and auditing internal manufacturing and external third party SAP master data, aligning with our internal and external standard business processes. Responsibilities include delivering trusted data accurately and efficiently; monitor, analyze, and continuously improve master data quality and effectiveness; ensure master data integrity is maintained though governance processes and procedures; and support new Product initiatives, as we strive to exceed our internal and external customer’s expectations.




At Keurig Dr Pepper (KDP) the consumer is at the heart of everything we do. Join the team at KDP and make a difference to consumers with one of America’s leading producers and distributors of hot and cold beverages helping to satisfy every consumer’s beverage need, anytime and anywhere.
















What you will do:













Setup new / update existing master data fields in SAP; including but not limited to Materials, BOM’s, Routings, Work Centers, Production Versions in a timely manner according to service level agreements, standard operating rules, and various supporting system applications (e.g., InterSpec, Teams, Sharepoint, etc.)
Audit, analyze and reconcile master data fields in SAP following Governance processes and procedures on a daily and periodic basis.
Investigate and resolve data incidents by collaborating internally and with business partners to identify root causes, implement corrective actions using the SC MD CAR (Corrective Action Request) process.
Identify data improvement opportunities and work collaboratively with peers and business partners to implement improvement initiatives.
Participate in decision making process to enable and optimize data governance processes and data quality monitoring processes.
Assist in creation and maintenance of training materials and work instructions to ensure information is current and effective for end users.
Maintain and promote an environment of team work and collaboration. Backup team members when/where required.
Maintain and update current Dashboards providing data analysis through Power BI.
Maintain weekly report of top three downtime offenders for the Plant, and assist in data collection efforts for improvement projects.
Follow all safety policies, procedures, and regulations.



















Characteristics for Success:







Bachelor’s degree preferred.
Effective critical thinking skills, and ability to analyze data to identify errors and root causes.
Strong collaboration and written / verbal communication skills.
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
Possess a good understanding of computer and industrial networks.
Ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines.
Ability to work independently.
Ability to effectively perform in a fast-paced, dynamic work environment.



















Total Rewards:




Salary Range: $52,500 - $86,000 / year.
Actual placement within the compensation range may vary depending on experience, skills, and other factors
Benefits, subject to election and eligibility: Medical, Dental, Vision, Disability, Paid Time Off (including paid parental leave, vacation, and sick time), 401k with company match, Tuition Reimbursement, and Mileage Reimbursement
Annual bonus based on performance and eligibility































Requirements:







2 years of experience to include master data processes & technology, data governance principles, or manufacturing process experience
Prior SAP or a similar ERP system experience
Experience creating, updating, and maintaining Microsoft Excel spreadsheets (including but not limited to VLookUps, Pivot Tables, Charts, etc)


































Keurig Dr Pepper (NASDAQ: KDP) is a leading beverage company in North America, with a portfolio of more than 125 owned, licensed and partners brands and powerful distribution capabilities to provide a beverage for every need, anytime, anywhere. We operate with a differentiated business model and world-class brand portfolio, powered by a talented and engaged team that is anchored in our values. We work with big, exciting beverage brands and the #1 single-serve coffee brewing system in North America at KDP, and we have fun doing it!




Together, we have built a leading beverage company in North America offering hot and cold beverages together at scale. Whatever your area of expertise, at KDP you can be a part of a team that’s proud of its brands, partnerships, innovation, and growth. Will you join us?




We strive to be an employer of choice, providing a culture and opportunities that empower our team of ~28,000 employees to grow and develop. We offer robust benefits to support your health and wellness as well as your personal and financial well-being. We also provide employee programs designed to enhance your professional growth and development, while ensuring you feel valued, inspired and appreciated at work.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Salary Range $85,000 - $110,000*

Job Description

Who We Are:

Saks is a world-renowned luxury ecommerce destination. The company’s unique approach combines a focus on the digital customer experience with a strong connection to a network of extraordinary stores that extends that seamless experience into the real world.

On its website and app, Saks offers an unparalleled selection of curated merchandise across fashion for women and men, beauty, jewelry, home décor and more. In addition to the shopping experience, customers come to Saks for inspiring editorial content, access to digital stylists, lifestyle experiences and other world-class services.

Role Summary

As a Data Analyst you will utilize your excellent technical skills to help us build a scalable Tableau platform. Your strong passion for data will help our business partners adopt Tableau for dashboards and visualizations to derive valuable business insights and eliminate technical and economic constraints from legacy BI tools.

Key Qualifications


Proven experience supporting enterprise BI platforms, Tableau preferred.
SQL power user (e.g., query optimization, CTEs, materialized views, windowing functions etc.)
5+ years of experience in related analytical or data engineering fields
Experience with dashboard building and optimization in visualization / business intelligence platforms like Looker or Tableau
Exposure to DBT or similar analytics workflow tools
Experience with cloud data platforms ( Snowflake preferred)
Experience with data governance (e.g., defining procedures, establishing change management policies etc)
Bonus points for exposure to AtScale modeling


Role Description


Manage and maintain enterprise Tableau environment including configurations and visualizations while utilizing a secondary tool for its semantic layer
Own associate Tableau implementation by creating set user permissions, data governance and best practices
Mentor team on best practices through documentation, collaboration, training, and PR reviews
Manage Tableau authentication and authorization
Design and develop reports and dashboards required by business partners, ensure that dashboards are designed with permissions in mind
Assist analysts, business users, and citizen data scientist with all BI tools
Work with Analytics Engineers and DataOps to develop data pipelines and model required data sets
Support Migration efforts from legacy BI tools


Your Life And Career At Saks


Be a part of an entrepreneurial team hyper focused on massive growth
Convenient and collaborative modern offices in Lower Manhattan with onsite perks
Benefits package for all eligible full-time employees (including medical, vision and dental)
An amazing employee discount

Title: Jr Data Analyst
Description:
The Coca-Cola Company is actively seeking a Jr Data Analyst, in Information Technology, specializing in Business and Product Management. This pivotal role demands a candidate skillful in orchestrating our organization's IT resources, adept in bridging the gap between business needs and tech solutions, and proficient in Agile methodologies for IT solution delivery. We are seeking a visionary who is committed to contributing to our organization’s IT roadmap and who can wield technology as a transformative tool to amplify our business operations.

What You'll Do For Us


Provide support between application development teams and business units to ensure the seamless development and enhancement of systems, perfectly translating business needs into technical solutions.
Engage in rigorous cost/benefit analyses, determining the viability and strategic placement of IT projects within our IT roadmap.
Cultivate and foster robust relationships with bottling partners to navigate and guide significant IT transformations.
Bring innovation to the table by seeking and integrating cutting-edge technological solutions and maintaining a critical eye for process improvements.
Drive the Agile methodology within project teams, championing incremental value delivery and efficient backlog and release management.
Ascertain new IT advancements and evolving business requirements, presenting system alternatives or enhancements pragmatically.
Navigate potential product delivery impediments adeptly, ensuring the continuity and momentum of IT initiatives.
Establish yourself as the IT Business Partner, managing stakeholder expectations and liaising effectively with external vendors.


Qualifications And Requirements


English proficiency is a must.
Experience in managing data products from ingestion to operations, with at least 1+ years in the field.
1+ years of hands-on experience in supporting data analytics solutions.
Proficiency in Python and SQL databases, with a solid understanding of CI/CD tools (e.g., Bitbucket, GitHub, GoCD, Bamboo, Terraform).
Strong command of data modeling, architecture, and Git-based version control.
Demonstrated experience with Azure platform and familiar with a variety of Data Services.
Comfortable with Agile/DevOps project methodologies, fostering a collaborative and efficient project environment.

We commit to nurturing a purpose-driven environment, one that empowers every member of our family to champion environmental protection and community well-being while ensuring the delivery of safe, top-quality products.

Database Design; Technologically Savvy; English Language; Agile Methodology; IT Development; DevOps; Microsoft Power Business Intelligence (BI); Business Integrations; SQL Databases; Information Technology Project Management

Title: Data Analyst II - Store Analytics (REMOTE)
Description:
At DICK’S Sporting Goods, we believe in how positively sports can change lives. On our team, everyone plays a critical role in creating confidence and excitement by personally equipping all athletes to achieve their dreams. We are committed to creating an inclusive and diverse workforce, reflecting the communities we serve.

If you are ready to make a difference as part of the world’s greatest sports team, apply to join our team today!

Overview

At DICK’S Sporting Goods, we believe sports can change lives. Founded in 1948, DICK’S Sporting Goods first started as a bait-and-tackle shop in Binghamton, NY and has since rapidly expanded into a leading omnichannel retailer with more than 850 locations representing our multiple brands: DICK’S, House of Sport, Golf Galaxy, Public Lands, Going Going Gone, and more. Over the years, it’s been our relentless focus on inspiring, supporting and equipping athletes and outdoor enthusiasts to achieve their dreams that has allowed us to become the $13B company we are today.

Our company is looking to invest in our future as we embark on a journey from being the best sports retailer in the world to becoming the best sports company in the world. We aim to build the ultimate athlete data set that will power our tools and platforms for the most personalized athlete experiences. Join us as we transform our technology, data and analytics to build next-gen tools and platforms for our athletes and teammates. If you are ready to make a difference as part of the world’s greatest sports company, apply today!

Job Purpose

The Store Analytics team is the lynch pin of driving our Athlete Experience strategy and measurement, sitting at the intersection of stores, technology, data, fulfillment, and merchandising. Our analyst team is critical to driving strategy, measurement, and valuation in stores, closely partnering with our Central Operations and Field teammates to uncover and unearth key insights to elevate our efficiency and productivity, ultimately delivering a seamless experience. This role works in emerging, innovative technologies to drive efficiency and productivity in our stores, and thrives in a space where activating a seamless experience is currency. Key to success in this role is serving as a field and process liaison, marrying data and analytics with store application and activation.

Responsibilities

Analytics & Testing


Under supervision, synthesize myriad data sources into holistic narratives to address business opportunities and strategic direction.
Utilize existing reporting systems to create reports, deriving information from multiple sources, to develop cohesive presentation of KPIs that is easy-to-understand.
Perform and support detailed ad hoc, short-term and mid-term analyses on quantitative and qualitative data to answer business questions and/or help inform strategic direction.
With direction and training, develop statistically sound test designs.
With direction and training, utilize common tools and platforms (e.g. SQL, GCP, Excel), and/or vendor platforms (Facebook, Instagram, DV360) to query, join, extract, and manipulate raw data from disparate sources to tell a comprehensive story with key insights and recommended actions.


Business Stakeholder Support


With supervision, develop and deliver ad hoc reports and analyses to business stakeholders.
Support formal and informal training sessions with client groups to enable business stakeholders to answer questions via self-service tools such as Intera (internal BI tool) and PowerBI.


Qualifications


Bachelor's Degree or Equivalent Level Preferred in Economics, Statistics, Liberal Arts or Related Field
1-3 Years of Experience


SQL, R, Python, experience with BI tools (Tableau, Qlik, PowerBI) preferred;GCP or Azure Experience

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Make a Difference in Your Community

Are you passionate about making a difference in the lives of individuals experiencing homelessness and hunger in Atlanta? Intown Cares, a 501(c)(3) nonprofit leading the Atlanta community in homeless outreach and food security programs, is seeking a motivated and collaborative Data Analyst to join our growing team. Founded in 2010, Intown has grown tremendously, more than doubling in size over the past five years. Intown’s 25+ passionate team members have housed over 500 individuals in the past two years and 1,000 since 2017, and the Data Analyst will play a critical role in continuing this success and growth.

What You’ll Do

The role of the Data Analyst is to support the organization’s efforts to manage, assess, analyze, and report

program and development data. Intown relies on timely and reliable data to drive the effectiveness and growth of its programming and fundraising efforts, so you will be in an exciting and pivotal position critical to the organization’s success. You’ll also have the opportunity to regularly interact with all members of Intown’s leadership team as the areas of responsibility for this role overlap with numerous departments. To be successful, you must have effective communication and strong collaboration skills in addition to your technical and analytical expertise.

Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field (Statistics, Social Sciences, Economics, etc.)
0-5 years of experience in data management
Experience in data analysis or equivalent educational experience
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel
Familiarity with various databases and CRM software
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Strong ability to work cross-functionally, collaborating effectively with diverse teams and stakeholders
Passion for sharing your gifts and talents with neighbors experiencing homelessness and hunger


Responsibilities

Data Management and Analysis


Collaborate with organizational leadership to develop tools for measuring program effectiveness


and provide staff training on accurate data collection techniques


Utilize statistical methods to analyze and interpret data patterns and trends, driving program design


and performance reporting for key stakeholders


Monitor and analyze local and national trends in homelessness and food insecurity to guide strategic


initiatives


Prepare insightful reports for management and leadership, presenting data-driven trends, patterns,


and forecasts to support decision-making


Ensure data quality, manage databases, and maintain systems for Homeless Services and Food


Programs using Apricot Social Solutions, VolunteerHub, and ClientTrack (HMIS for Atlanta’s

Continuum of Care).

Development (Fundraising) Support


Assist the Development team by providing data on program outcomes to support fundraising efforts
Generate reports in NEON CRM, Intown’s donor database, to support the Development department
Collaborate with the Grants Manager to compile data for reporting to government agencies and


other funders

Program Support


Provide data collection and analysis support for Homeless Services and Food Programs, both for


internal evaluations and external reporting


Compile and distribute monthly or quarterly program reports for individual programs and larger


initiatives


Assist with the preparation and dissemination of documents for meetings and other key events


Work Hours and Location

The Data Analyst position is a full-time, 40 hours per week position. The Data Analyst is expected to work in

Intown’s Atlanta office at least two days a week with a hybrid work schedule possible.

Supervision

The Data Analyst reports to Intown Cares’ Director of Finance and Operations.

Compensation And Benefits

The Data Analyst position is a salaried position with a starting annual base salary range of $54,000-$65,000, which will be paid in equal installments every two weeks according to Intown’s regularly scheduled paydays. Benefits include healthcare, dental, and vision insurance—with employer contributions—as well as healthcare and dependent care FSAs, 403b retirement plan, professional development resources, and generous personal and vacation days off. This position is exempt and therefore not eligible for overtime pay for any additional hours worked. The position is eligible for all employee benefits.

Intown Cares’ Core Values

Intown Cares’ work is guided by five core values all of which we look for within each of our team members

(frontline Staff, Leadership, And Board Members)


Dignity: Treating all people with respect and compassion
Relationships: Building meaningful partnerships with our clients and others to address homelessness


and hunger in our community


Accountability: Building meaningful partnerships with our clients and others to address homelessness


and hunger in our community


Empowerment: Fostering a community where clients, staff, board, and volunteers are able to achieve


their potential


Sustainability: Focusing on delivering long-term solutions for our clients while ensuring we will be here


for as long as we are needed

Intown considers applicants without regard to race, ethnicity, religion, gender identification, sexual orientation, national origin, age, marital or veteran status, the presence of a non-job-related medical condition or disability, or any other legally protected status.

Title: Data Analyst Internship
Description:
Worth AI, a forward-thinking company in the computer software industry, is excited to offer a Data Analyst Internship for aspiring data enthusiasts. At Worth AI, we are dedicated to harnessing the power of AI to transform decision-making while promoting equity, diversity, and inclusion in our work environment. This internship will provide you with an excellent opportunity to gain hands-on experience in data analytics within a supportive team.

As a Data Analyst Intern, you will play a key role in analyzing data, generating insights, and contributing to meaningful projects. You will work closely with experienced data professionals, gaining valuable exposure to the tools and techniques used in data analysis. This is a fantastic opportunity to enhance your analytical skills while contributing to impactful initiatives.

Assist in collecting, cleaning, and validating data from various sources
Conduct exploratory data analysis to uncover trends, patterns, and insights
Support the team in generating reports and visualizations to communicate findings effectively
Participate in brainstorming sessions and contribute ideas to enhance data analysis practices
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into data-focused solutions

Stay current with industry trends and advancements in data analytics tools and techniques



Requirements


Currently pursuing a degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field
Basic proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, Python, or R
Understanding of fundamental statistical concepts and methods
Interest in data visualization and familiarity with tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar
Good problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Strong communication skills, with the ability to present findings clearly
A collaborative mindset with a willingness to learn and grow in a team environment



Benefits


A great Internship experience !

Title: Data and Reporting Analyst
Description:
We are seeking a Data Analyst to join our client's team. This role involves collecting, reviewing, and publishing market pricing and incentive program information for our staff and shareholders. You will analyze key business insights such as marketing program qualifications, earnings forecasts, product import records, and supplier performance. Additionally, you will manage the accuracy and accessibility of purchase and sales reports.

Data Management:

Maintain strong attention to detail to ensure accuracy in all reports and databases.

Strong proficiency in data analysis tools and software (e.g., SQL, Python, R, Excel).
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret complex data into actionable insights.
Strong attention to detail and accuracy.
Effective communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.
Familiarity with data management and quality assurance principles.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
About Wing

Wing offers drone delivery as a safe, fast, and sustainable solution for last mile logistics. Consumer appetites for on-demand services are increasing, but current delivery methods are inefficient, costly, and contribute to road accidents and air pollution. Wing’s fleet of highly automated delivery drones can transport small packages directly from businesses to homes on-demand, in minutes. We design, build, and operate our aircraft, and offer drone delivery services on three continents. Our technology is designed to be easy to integrate into existing delivery and logistics networks, offering a scalable drone delivery solution for a broad range of businesses. Wing is a part of Google's parent company, Alphabet, and our mission is to create the preferred means of delivery for the planet. To do this, we must build a workforce that's representative of the global communities that we serve. If you're ready to do the greatest work of your life, come join us.

About The Role

We are seeking a highly motivated, analytical, and detail-oriented Business Intelligence Analyst to join the BIA team at Wing. The ideal candidate will be a self-starter, solution-oriented, comfortable with ambiguity, and passionate about problem solving. You will be responsible for developing the BIA data infrastructure needed to support a scaling company, analyzing complex data sets to uncover trends, developing and deploying dashboards that provide users with critical insights, and solving complex business problems at the forefront of commercial drone delivery. Open to remote candidates; location preference is Palo Alto, CA.

What You’ll Do


Analyze complex data sets to identify key trends, develop forecasts, build predictive models, and derive insights needed to drive business impact and increase operational efficiency
Identify and implement opportunities for automation
Develop and maintain business intelligence reports and dashboards
Define, measure, and report on the metrics required to measure business performance
Contribute to a data analytics infrastructure that is cohesive, scalable and aligns with data governance goals, ensuring that reporting and metrics are unified across the company
Solve complex business problems using quantitative approaches
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and deliver impact-driven solutions
Build an understanding of our data resources and how/when to apply them to different initiatives


What You’ll Need


Bachelor's/Master’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g. data analytics, data science, math)
5+ years of experience in business intelligence, data analytics, or data science
Strong experience with analytics and data visualization tools; including: SQL, Python and Excel
Proven ability to translate business problems into data-driven projects and solutions
Excellent communication - both written and verbal - and presentation skills
A team player with a problem-solver mindset
Thrives in fast paced and ambiguous environments with an appetite for innovation
Experience in fulfillment, logistics or supply chain is a plus


The US base salary range for this full-time position is the salary range below + bonus + equity + benefits. Wing’s salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your location during the hiring process.

Salary Range

$112,000 — $166,000 USD

Make a Difference in Your Community

Are you passionate about making a difference in the lives of individuals experiencing homelessness and hunger in Atlanta? Intown Cares, a 501(c)(3) nonprofit leading the Atlanta community in homeless outreach and food security programs, is seeking a motivated and collaborative Data Analyst to join our growing team. Founded in 2010, Intown has grown tremendously, more than doubling in size over the past five years. Intown’s 25+ passionate team members have housed over 500 individuals in the past two years and 1,000 since 2017, and the Data Analyst will play a critical role in continuing this success and growth.

What You’ll Do

The role of the Data Analyst is to support the organization’s efforts to manage, assess, analyze, and report

program and development data. Intown relies on timely and reliable data to drive the effectiveness and growth of its programming and fundraising efforts, so you will be in an exciting and pivotal position critical to the organization’s success. You’ll also have the opportunity to regularly interact with all members of Intown’s leadership team as the areas of responsibility for this role overlap with numerous departments. To be successful, you must have effective communication and strong collaboration skills in addition to your technical and analytical expertise.

Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field (Statistics, Social Sciences, Economics, etc.)
0-5 years of experience in data management
Experience in data analysis or equivalent educational experience
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel
Familiarity with various databases and CRM software
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Strong ability to work cross-functionally, collaborating effectively with diverse teams and stakeholders
Passion for sharing your gifts and talents with neighbors experiencing homelessness and hunger


Responsibilities

Data Management and Analysis


Collaborate with organizational leadership to develop tools for measuring program effectiveness


and provide staff training on accurate data collection techniques


Utilize statistical methods to analyze and interpret data patterns and trends, driving program design


and performance reporting for key stakeholders


Monitor and analyze local and national trends in homelessness and food insecurity to guide strategic


initiatives


Prepare insightful reports for management and leadership, presenting data-driven trends, patterns,


and forecasts to support decision-making


Ensure data quality, manage databases, and maintain systems for Homeless Services and Food


Programs using Apricot Social Solutions, VolunteerHub, and ClientTrack (HMIS for Atlanta’s

Continuum of Care).

Development (Fundraising) Support


Assist the Development team by providing data on program outcomes to support fundraising efforts
Generate reports in NEON CRM, Intown’s donor database, to support the Development department
Collaborate with the Grants Manager to compile data for reporting to government agencies and


other funders

Program Support


Provide data collection and analysis support for Homeless Services and Food Programs, both for


internal evaluations and external reporting


Compile and distribute monthly or quarterly program reports for individual programs and larger


initiatives


Assist with the preparation and dissemination of documents for meetings and other key events


Work Hours and Location

The Data Analyst position is a full-time, 40 hours per week position. The Data Analyst is expected to work in

Intown’s Atlanta office at least two days a week with a hybrid work schedule possible.

Supervision

The Data Analyst reports to Intown Cares’ Director of Finance and Operations.

Compensation And Benefits

The Data Analyst position is a salaried position with a starting annual base salary range of $54,000-$65,000, which will be paid in equal installments every two weeks according to Intown’s regularly scheduled paydays. Benefits include healthcare, dental, and vision insurance—with employer contributions—as well as healthcare and dependent care FSAs, 403b retirement plan, professional development resources, and generous personal and vacation days off. This position is exempt and therefore not eligible for overtime pay for any additional hours worked. The position is eligible for all employee benefits.

(frontline Staff, Leadership, And Board Members)


Dignity: Treating all people with respect and compassion
Relationships: Building meaningful partnerships with our clients and others to address homelessness


and hunger in our community


Accountability: Building meaningful partnerships with our clients and others to address homelessness

their potential


Sustainability: Focusing on delivering long-term solutions for our clients while ensuring we will be here


for as long as we are needed

Intown’s 25+ passionate team members have housed over 500 individuals in the past two years and 1,000 since 2017, and the Data Analyst will play a critical role in continuing this success and growth.

What You’ll Do

The role of the Data Analyst is to support the organization’s efforts to manage, assess, analyze, and report

program and development data. Intown relies on timely and reliable data to drive the effectiveness and growth of its programming and fundraising efforts, so you will be in an exciting and pivotal position critical to the organization’s success. You’ll also have the opportunity to regularly interact with all members of Intown’s leadership team as the areas of responsibility for this role overlap with numerous departments. To be successful, you must have effective communication and strong collaboration skills in addition to your technical and analytical expertise.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field (Statistics, Social Sciences, Economics, etc.)
  • 0-5 years of experience in data management
  • Experience in data analysis or equivalent educational experience
  • Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel
  • Familiarity with various databases and CRM software
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Strong ability to work cross-functionally, collaborating effectively with diverse teams and stakeholders
  • Passion for sharing your gifts and talents with neighbors experiencing homelessness and hunger

Responsibilities

Data Management and Analysis

  • Collaborate with organizational leadership to develop tools for measuring program effectiveness

and provide staff training on accurate data collection techniques

  • Utilize statistical methods to analyze and interpret data patterns and trends, driving program design

and performance reporting for key stakeholders

  • Monitor and analyze local and national trends in homelessness and food insecurity to guide strategic

initiatives

  • Prepare insightful reports for management and leadership, presenting data-driven trends, patterns,

and forecasts to support decision-making

  • Ensure data quality, manage databases, and maintain systems for Homeless Services and Food

Programs using Apricot Social Solutions, VolunteerHub, and ClientTrack (HMIS for Atlanta’s

Continuum of Care).

Development (Fundraising) Support

  • Assist the Development team by providing data on program outcomes to support fundraising efforts
  • Generate reports in NEON CRM, Intown’s donor database, to support the Development department
  • Collaborate with the Grants Manager to compile data for reporting to government agencies and

other funders

Program Support

  • Provide data collection and analysis support for Homeless Services and Food Programs, both for

internal evaluations and external reporting

  • Compile and distribute monthly or quarterly program reports for individual programs and larger

initiatives

  • Assist with the preparation and dissemination of documents for meetings and other key events

Work Hours and Location

The Data Analyst position is a full-time, 40 hours per week position. The Data Analyst is expected to work in

Intown’s Atlanta office at least two days a week with a hybrid work schedule possible.

Supervision

The Data Analyst reports to Intown Cares’ Director of Finance and Operations.

Compensation And Benefits

The Data Analyst position is a salaried position with a starting annual base salary range of $54,000-$65,000, which will be paid in equal installments every two weeks according to Intown’s regularly scheduled paydays. Benefits include healthcare, dental, and vision insurance—with employer contributions—as well as healthcare and dependent care FSAs, 403b retirement plan, professional development resources, and generous personal and vacation days off. This position is exempt and therefore not eligible for overtime pay for any additional hours worked. The position is eligible for all employee benefits.

Intown Cares’ Core Values

Intown Cares’ work is guided by five core values all of which we look for within each of our team members

(frontline Staff, Leadership, And Board Members)

  • Dignity: Treating all people with respect and compassion
  • Relationships: Building meaningful partnerships with our clients and others to address homelessness

and hunger in our community

  • Accountability: Building meaningful partnerships with our clients and others to address homelessness

and hunger in our community

  • Empowerment: Fostering a community where clients, staff, board, and volunteers are able to achieve

their potential

  • Sustainability: Focusing on delivering long-term solutions for our clients while ensuring we will be here

for as long as we are needed

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
About Wing

Wing offers drone delivery as a safe, fast, and sustainable solution for last mile logistics. Consumer appetites for on-demand services are increasing, but current delivery methods are inefficient, costly, and contribute to road accidents and air pollution. Wing’s fleet of highly automated delivery drones can transport small packages directly from businesses to homes on-demand, in minutes. We design, build, and operate our aircraft, and offer drone delivery services on three continents. Our technology is designed to be easy to integrate into existing delivery and logistics networks, offering a scalable drone delivery solution for a broad range of businesses. Wing is a part of Google's parent company, Alphabet, and our mission is to create the preferred means of delivery for the planet. To do this, we must build a workforce that's representative of the global communities that we serve. If you're ready to do the greatest work of your life, come join us.

About The Role

We are seeking a highly motivated, analytical, and detail-oriented Business Intelligence Analyst to join the BIA team at Wing. The ideal candidate will be a self-starter, solution-oriented, comfortable with ambiguity, and passionate about problem solving. You will be responsible for developing the BIA data infrastructure needed to support a scaling company, analyzing complex data sets to uncover trends, developing and deploying dashboards that provide users with critical insights, and solving complex business problems at the forefront of commercial drone delivery. Open to remote candidates; location preference is Palo Alto, CA.

What You’ll Do


Analyze complex data sets to identify key trends, develop forecasts, build predictive models, and derive insights needed to drive business impact and increase operational efficiency
Identify and implement opportunities for automation
Develop and maintain business intelligence reports and dashboards
Define, measure, and report on the metrics required to measure business performance
Contribute to a data analytics infrastructure that is cohesive, scalable and aligns with data governance goals, ensuring that reporting and metrics are unified across the company
Solve complex business problems using quantitative approaches
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and deliver impact-driven solutions
Build an understanding of our data resources and how/when to apply them to different initiatives


What You’ll Need


Bachelor's/Master’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g. data analytics, data science, math)
5+ years of experience in business intelligence, data analytics, or data science
Strong experience with analytics and data visualization tools; including: SQL, Python and Excel
Proven ability to translate business problems into data-driven projects and solutions
Excellent communication - both written and verbal - and presentation skills
A team player with a problem-solver mindset
Thrives in fast paced and ambiguous environments with an appetite for innovation
Experience in fulfillment, logistics or supply chain is a plus


The US base salary range for this full-time position is the salary range below + bonus + equity + benefits. Wing’s salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your location during the hiring process.

Salary Range

$112,000 — $166,000 USD

Data Analysis:

Collaborate with various departments to gather data requirements and conduct analyses to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies.
Assist in data cleansing and transformation to ensure accuracy and reliability for reporting purposes.

Learning and Growth:

Stay informed about the latest data analysis tools, best practices, and industry trends.
Proactively seek opportunities to enhance technical skills and contribute to the overall success of the team.

Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field such as Business Analytics, Computer Science, or Information Systems.
Basic understanding of data analysis concepts and principles.
Familiarity with data analysis tools is an advantage but not required.
Strong analytical skills with a passion for transforming data into actionable insights.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
Enthusiasm for learning and a proactive approach to professional development.
Ability to collaborate effectively within a team and adapt to changing priorities.
Graduated.

The ideal candidate can support critical decision-making with data insights and reporting needs.  While the role is primarily responsible for analyzing and deriving insights from data, it is expected to provide necessary support in building and improving Articulate’s data literacy and infrastructure.




What you'll do:
Data Analysis:
Translate business problems into quantitative questions.
Perform analysis with multiple data sources to provide insights and actionable recommendations.

Partner with Analytics Engineers in implementing data quality control processes.

3 -5 years of experience with data analysis, statistics, business intelligence or other relevant fields.

Experience working with event data such as Segment data.
Experience working with a product analytics tool such as Mixpanel.

Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Ability to assess data and provide specific insights and business recommendations through storytelling.
Experience gathering business requirements, creating ad-hoc reports, and designing scalable solutions to automate those ad-hoc reports.
Ability to foster collaborative relationships and support cross-functional teams throughout the company across technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Continuous improvement attitude; ability to suggest and implement best practices.
A team-first mindset with a scrappy mentality and a desire to continually learn.




Nice to haves:
Experience with Mixpanel, Segment, Looker, dbt, and Snowflake.

Highly organized with strong attention to detail.
Experience with Salesforce (or similar CRM), and Marketo.

Excellent problem-solving abilities and attention to detail.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Te preguntarás, ¿qué es BBVA Creative?

BBVA Creative es la agencia in-house de BBVA; una agencia in-house es como cualquier otra agencia creativa pero que trabaja para una sola marca. BBVA Creative trabaja para la marca BBVA y esta es tan grande, global y diversa que ningún día se parece al siguiente. Nuestro propósito es crear y distribuir historias que hagan sentir la marca de formas sorprendentes.




¿Qué buscamos?

En BBVA Creative nos gustaría incorporar un perfil de Sr. Data Analyst, con al menos cuatro años de experiencia que, reportando a Head of Digital Planning & Digital Marketing Manager, se responsabilizará de analizar el rendimiento de las campañas digitales, así como de generar y optimizar dashboards automáticos que ayuden a la toma de decisiones clave para el negocio. 




Nos gustaría que aportes tu experiencia en el desarrollo de las siguientes tareas:

Organizar fuentes de datos y establecer una metodología de análisis y recopilación de la información.
Analizar el rendimiento de campañas digitales para identificar tendencias y patrones que permitan su optimización en herramientas como Google Ads, Facebook Ads o LinkedIn Ads, entre otras.
Creación de informes en herramientas como Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics o Data Studio. Para ello debes tener un conocimiento profundo de métricas clave de marketing digital (CTR, CPC, ROAS, conversion rate, etc.).
Personalizar dashboards según las necesidades del negocio y automatizar reportes en Power BI.
Realizar estudios de consumidores, comportamiento digital, tendencias y benchmarks de la industria financiera y otras.




Todas las aptitudes son bienvenidas; te ajustarás mejor a lo que estamos buscando si:

Tienes capacidad para traducir datos complejos en insights accionables para las áreas de marketing y negocio, ayudando en la toma de decisiones estratégicas.
Sabes cómo abordar problemas complejos, proponer soluciones innovadoras y optimizar procesos continuamente.
Tienes experiencia en presentar y explicar los resultados de análisis de manera clara a stakeholders no técnicos, como el equipo de marketing o dirección.
Tienes conocimiento del A/B testing y experimentación para evaluar el impacto de cambios en campañas digitales.
Tienes habilidad para entender las necesidades de negocio y traducirlas en preguntas de análisis.
Tienes la capacidad para gestionar varios proyectos simultáneamente, priorizando según las necesidades del negocio.
Has utilizado Sprinklr.
Tienes conocimiento sobre los distintos modelos de atribución y fases del funnel.
Tienes conocimientos en técnicas estadísticas avanzadas para predecir el rendimiento de las campañas y sugerir optimizaciones.
Eres una persona orientada a objetivos.
Sabes trabajar en equipo.
Cuentas con inglés ﬂuido tanto en escritura como en conversación.




Aunque no es imprescindible, nos encantaría si además…

Has activado y optimizado campañas digitales full funnel.
Tienes experiencia previa en agencia. 
Has trabajado con equipos multidisciplinares.
Cuentas con capacidad para construir relaciones positivas con equipos internos y clientes.
Tienes fuertes habilidades de comunicación y capacidad para desarrollar asociaciones sólidas entre disciplinas y socios.




Si entras en la compañía tendrás lo siguiente:

Contratación indefinida con convenio de publicidad.
Lanzadera desde distintos puntos de Madrid a las oficinas de BBVA Creative.
Ayuda alimentaria.
Retribución flexible (guardería, Internet, ayuda al transporte, copago inglés,…).
Formación continua.
Gympass.
Flexibilidad horaria.
Modelo híbrido de teletrabajo (60% teletrabajo tras el período de prueba).
Ambiente de trabajo dinámico y creativo.




En BBVA Creative creemos que una plantilla diversa nos hace mejor agencia. Nos enorgullece ser una empresa que prioriza la diversidad, inclusión e igualdad de oportunidades sin importarnos la raza, edad, género, etnia, religión, orientación sexual o cualquier otra circunstancia de nuestra plantilla y colaboradores.

BBVA Creative busca fortalecer nuestra marca global y localmente, colaborando con quienes comparten este objetivo, aportando valor estratégico y sumando nuestro poder creativo a la comunicación. ¿Te apuntas?




Línea de tiempo del proceso:

Recepción de candidaturas (del 02/10/2024 al 13/10/2024). 
Si valoramos que cumples los requisitos que buscamos, te enviaremos pruebas y un formulario preguntándote alguna cosa más (del 14/10/2024 al 30/10/2024).
Si continúas en el proceso realizarás las entrevistas con el equipo de selección y con el equipo (del 21/10/2024 y el 31/10/2024).
Incorporación aproximada: diciembre 2024.

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
The Studio Operations team is a global team across 30+ locations and includes Quality Verification and Standards, Central Development Operations, Localization, Animation, Audio, Capture, Rigging and Blendshapes. As a central team, we bring together the best development solutions to further support game teams in achieving their vision and EA's ambition to be the best place to make games.

Within Studio Operations, we are members of the Player & Quality Insights team that focuses on understanding player behavior and designing player feedback events which help game teams develop high-quality games to meet our player's expectations. We are a data-driven team where every major decision starts with data analysis to find opportunity areas and to measure our efforts.

Working alongside our Data Analysts team, you will oversee and conduct the conversion of data into insights to lead to informed decisions. You will help with the development, implementation, testing and maintenance of our data systems infrastructure, including semantic models, dashboards and reports to help teams analyse and investigate their results.

Key Duties and Responsibilities


Conduct data analyses using statistical software, databases and BI tools
Develop and maintain scripts and queries to import, manipulate and clean data from different sources
Create, operate and maintain script-driven methodologies for the generation of analysis and reports.
Perform quality assurance on generated results to ensure accuracy and consistency
Interacting with internal clients
Dealing with data providers in client organizations, specifically in the development of data requests, checking of data received, and follow up with data providers on data issues.
Dealing directly with clients on projects involving technical methodologies
Presenting results to clients in a clear and respectful manner, and maintaining professionalism in collecting feedback
Project management and quality assurance of active projects
Dashboard and Visualization Development
Develop visually appealing and intuitive dashboards
Leverage advanced visualization techniques to effectively communicate insights
Ensure adherence to best practices in data visualization, story building and user experience design

Required


Student of Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science, Economics or similar studies.
Advanced level of English, both written and verbal, strong communication skills
Strong analytical skills
Knowledge of SQL, R Statistical software and/or Python
Knowledge of Business Intelligence principles and concepts
Interest in gaming is a big plus.

Title: DATA ANALYST
Description:
Logista es el distribuidor de proximidad líder en el sur de Europa. Sirve regularmente a más de 300.000 puntos de venta en España, Francia, Italia, Portugal, Polonia y Países Bajos. Facilita el mejor y más rápido acceso al mercado de una amplia gama de productos de conveniencia, farmacéuticos, recarga electrónica, libros, publicaciones, tabaco y loterías, entre otros. Logista

cuenta con un equipo de profesionales altamente cualificados integrado por más de 7.000 empleados directos y 16.000 colaboradores, centrados en dar servicio a sus clientes del modo más eficiente y adaptado a sus necesidades.




El equipo:

En el departamento de Business Analytics nos encargamos de ayudar y apoyar a los diferentes negocios del grupo en la transformación digital, ayudándoles a procesar, explotar y extraer el mayor valor posible de los datos que generan. En el equipo de Advanced Analytics del que formarías parte somos la punta de lanza en el desarrollo de algoritmos, aplicación de modelos estadísticos e IA y diseño de visualizaciones de datos. Trabajamos en una gran variedad de proyectos tales como la realización de estimaciones estadísticas de mercados, predicción de la demanda de productos, creación de motores de recomendaciones para compra online, segmentaciones de clientes o automatizaciones de procesos.

Tu rol y funciones:

Buscamos reforzar nuestro equipo para una rama de proyectos que abarcan desde la definición e integración de nuevas fuentes de datos, hasta el desarrollo y comercialización de servicios de datos; enfocado en formar un especialista en métodos de estimación de mercados para ser una futura referencia en el departamento. En concreto realizaras las siguientes tareas:

Desarrollo de estimaciones estadísticas sobre mercados. Diagnóstico de desviaciones e implementación de mejoras y correcciones.
Creación y mantenimiento de maestros de datos para alimentar los modelos.
Desarrollar automatizaciones para optimizar procesos manuales.
Uso y adaptación de modelos de Machine Learning para clasificación y regresión.
Definición, escritura y control de flujos de ingesta, ELT y de calidad de dato.
Apoyo en el despliegue de soluciones en entornos Cloud (Azure).

Requisitos:

Dos o más años de experiencia en analítica, ingeniería, ciencia de datos o programación.
Graduado de grado de la rama de las Ciencias de la Computación, Ingeniería, Matemáticas o similares.
Experiencia de programación en SQL, R/Python; aunque otros lenguajes también son valorables.
Conocimientos de estadística. Conceptos como descriptores estadísticos, muestreo o normalización no te deberían ser ajenos.
Curiosidad y practicidad. Buscamos alguien que quiera entender las necesidades de nuestros negocios y así ayudarles a generar el mayor valor posible del dato.
Mentalidad enfocada a la resolución de problemas y el pensamiento out-of-the-box. Capacidad de analizar problemas complejos y extrapolar información incompleta.

Otros valorables:

Máster o estudios de postgrado en Data Science, AI, Big Data o similares.
Experiencia en herramientas de almacenaje, procesamiento y analítica de datos como Snowflake, DataBricks, Dataiku, etc.
Formación o experiencia sobre despliegues en entornos Cloud y de MLOps.
Nociones sobre modelos de IA (modelos clásicos de ML, DL y GenAI).
Nivel de inglés alto.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you an experienced Data Analyst – Insurance?




We are currently looking for an experience data analyst with experience in the Insurance Industry. As a Data Analyst at thewave you will work on interpreting data, analyzing results, and providing insights to aid decision-making for our clients within the Insurance Sector. They typically work with large volumes of data, often using statistical techniques and software tools to uncover trends, patterns, and correlations. Our Data Analysts are instrumental in helping our clients understand their data, identify opportunities, and solve problems.




Overall, our Data Consultants play a crucial role in helping organizations derive actionable insights from data to drive business growth and decision-making. They combine technical expertise with business acumen to turn raw data into meaningful information that drives strategic initiatives and improves operational efficiency.







What do we offer?

Passion & fun

Besides our passion for insurance we believe in having fun from time to time, since happier employees perform better. Prepare for regular team updates & events and an exciting yearly calendar closing event (CCE)!




Training & Coaching

We strongly believe in training and coaching. Each employee receives a coach and a series of interesting trainings. We expect however the employee to play a pro-active role in this, outlining and managing his/her own career path. This may include taking internal responsibilities in a young company with ambitious growth plans.




Compensation & Benefits

We offer a full compensation & benefits package, consisting of an interesting salary, a motivating bonus scheme, representation and lunch allowances, eco-cheques, a cool company car with international fuel/electric card, a public transport subscription, a laptop, a deluxe smartphone and a hospitalization & group insurance.




What will you be doing?

1. Data Collection and Processing:

Gather data from various sources such as databases, spreadsheets, and APIs.
Clean and preprocess data to ensure accuracy and consistency.
Organize and structure data for analysis.




2. Data Analysis:

Apply statistical methods and analytical techniques to interpret data.
Identify trends, patterns, and correlations in the data.
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) to discover insights.
Conduct hypothesis testing and statistical inference.




3. Data Visualization:

Create visualizations such as charts, graphs, and dashboards to communicate insights effectively.
Use tools like Tableau, Power BI, or matplotlib for data visualization.
Design visually appealing and informative reports for stakeholders.




4. Reporting and Presentation:

Prepare reports and presentations summarizing findings and insights.
Communicate complex technical concepts in a clear and understandable manner.
Present findings to stakeholders, including management and non-technical audiences.




5. Data-driven Decision Making:

Collaborate with teams across the organization to understand business requirements.
Provide data-driven recommendations and insights to support decision-making processes.
Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics to track progress and performance.




6. Continuous Learning and Improvement:

Stay updated on emerging trends, tools, and technologies in data analysis.
Enhance analytical skills through training, certifications, and hands-on experience.
Share knowledge and best practices with colleagues to foster a culture of learning.




What do you need to bring?

Proficiency in SQL for data querying and manipulation.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong experience within the Insurance Industry.
Experience with statistical analysis and data visualization tools.
Familiarity with programming languages such as Python or R.
Knowledge of data warehousing concepts and data modeling.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Knowledge of Dutch and/or French, and English
Attention to detail and ability to work independently.
Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field such as statistics, mathematics, computer science, or related disciplines. A master’s degree or certifications in data analysis or related fields may be preferred.

Title: Portfolio Data Analyst
Description:
We offer:

• Contract via 3rd party agency

Title: Data Analyst en Seguimiento NPA's & Cost of Risk
Description:
Somos Banco Sabadell







Banco Sabadell es una de las principales entidades bancarias en España con más de 14.000 personas caracterizadas por nuestra implicación, espíritu de colaboración y dinamismo. Banco Sabadell ofrece sus servicios a más de 11 millones de clientes contando con una posición privilegiada en el segmento de empresas.




Nuestra razón de ser es ayudar a personas y empresas a hacer realidad sus proyectos, anticipándonos y ocupándonos de que tomen las mejores decisiones económicas, a través de nuestros valores: el compromiso, no conformismo, profesionalidad, eficacia, empatía y franqueza.Y además, lo hacemos mediante una gestión responsable y comprometida con el medio ambiente.




¡Únete a nosotros!







¿Qué estamos buscando?







Actualmente nos encontramos buscando un profesional con capacidad analítica y de negociación, altamente detallista y pulcro, para incorporarse a nuestra unidad de Seguimiento NPA's, como Data Analyst.




Hablemos del proyecto...




Tu misión se centrará en analizar la evolución del riesgo dudoso e impagados del Banco, de acuerdo a las directrices del Director de la Unidad, para alertar de posibles desvíos presupuestarios y ayudar en la toma de decisiones en la gestión recuperatoria.




Entre tus responsabilidades principales se encontrarán:




Analizarás las entradas en mora del banco para alertar de desviaciones presupuestarias.
Analizarás la concesión de riesgo nuevo para el seguimiento de la alta Dirección.
Propondrás mejoras en la gestión de la mora detectada en los análisis, para mejorar indicadores de recuperación gestionando más eficientemente.
Realizarás el presupuesto de mora del banco para poder medir el cumplimientos en cuanto a gestión de mora.
Validarás el sistemas de gestión para identificar incidencias y resolución de las mismas.




¿Qué valoramos de tu candidatura?




Estudios universitarios preferiblemente en ámbitos de Ingeniería, Matemáticas, Estadística, Física, Ciencias o Economía.
Experiencia mínima entre 2-3 años como Data Analyst.
Uso de bases de datos, hojas de cálculo Excel (avanzado) y Power point.
Imprescindible nociones de programación.
Muy valorable disponer de conocimientos de SAS, Power BI, Dossiers,…
Inglés nivel medio (B2).







Banco Sabadell está comprometido en promover ambientes de trabajo en los que se trate con respeto y dignidad a las personas, procurando el desarrollo profesional de la plantilla y garantizando la igualdad de oportunidades en su selección, formación y promoción ofreciendo un entorno de trabajo libre de cualquier discriminación por motivo de género, edad, orientación sexual, religión, etnia o cualquier otra circunstancia personal o social.

Banco Sabadell forma parte de la red de empresas con el distintivo de “Igualdad en la Empresa” otorgado por el Ministerio de Igualdad.

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
About Dialectica

Dialectica is the global leader in insights on-demand. We enable investment and business professionals to access untapped markets, competitive & customer insights powered by the world's hardest-to-find experts, and cutting-edge technology. Our team of +1,000 professionals in 5 offices spanning 3 continents, works with top-tier investment funds, management consulting firms, and Fortune 500 companies around the globe.

Driven by our mission to achieve unparalleled customer recognition, we are developing the most trusted and innovative knowledge-sharing platform in the world. Dialectica has been recognized as one of Europe's fastest-growing companies by the Financial Times for 4 years in a row, a Top Employer for Recent Graduates by The Career Directory in Canada and a Best Workplace.

We are looking for a highly resourceful and self-motivated Data Analyst Intern to join our team in developing data services for creating origination reports tailored to Private Equity (PE) clients. The intern will support various data enrichment tasks using Large Language Models (LLMs) and in-house databases, under the Data Product and Business Operations teams. Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
At Accion Labs, we believe in ‘Driving Outcomes Through Actions’. We seek solutions for tomorrow and build them today.

With us, you will be implementing these solutions alongside some of the best engineers, architects, and product managers across the globe.

You will experience product ownership while working with a tight-knit team of engineers, designers, and product managers and bring a passion for user experience as well as meticulous attention to detail in order to build intuitive and elegant user experiences.




Our Vision and Mission Statement is “To improve lives through purpose-driven technology innovation and be a global leader in innovative engineering”.




So, come join us in the Business Analyst - Data & Product role, to be part of one of our successful projects.







Day-to-day you will be responsible for:




Work closely with stakeholders to understand their data needs, product objectives, and requirements.
Analyze existing product performance, user data, and feedback to identify trends, gaps, and opportunities for improvement.
Collaborate with product managers to translate customer needs into data-driven insights to guide product development and prioritization.
Document business processes, product workflows, data flows, data dictionaries, data policies, and data governance standards.

Define data quality metrics, thresholds, and rules to measure and monitor data quality.
Present data-driven insights to both business and product stakeholders to support strategic decision-making and improve product offerings.
To be considered you will bring broad experience in a Business Analyst role with a focus on data and/or product analysis. You will work at pace to enable the delivery of data and product initiatives, starting with the development and implementation of a Data Governance framework.




Other experience required:




10+ years experience BA
Proficiency in data analyst tools such as SQL, SAS, Tableau, and Power BI.
Understanding of database systems and experience in querying databases.
Strong ability to interpret complex datasets and extract actionable insights for product optimization.
Excellent problem-solving skills to address product and business challenges using data-driven approaches.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We’re one of the world's leading carsharing platform, with millions of users around the world, sharing thousands of cars in over 950 cities across 8 countries.

Our mission is simple: Make our cities better places to live through carsharing.

Carsharing empowers people to move in a smarter and more sustainable way: studies show that one shared car replaces between 5 and 8 privately owned cars, which frees up space in our cities while giving communities 24/7 access to cars when they need them.

With our connected car technology, users can quickly and easily book and unlock a wide variety of vehicles directly from our app, without ever having to meet anyone in person, carry an access card, wait in line, or coordinate picking up keys.

To reach our vision of a world where all cars are shared, we need a strong team to help us disrupt car ownership. We look for people who are curious, positive, and engaged; who can adapt and learn quickly; who have the skills and smarts to reach their goals autonomously, while having the generosity and mindset to work collaboratively. No matter your role, background, or level of experience, we believe that every member of the team can have an impact.

We’re extremely proud to be certified one of the “Best Workplaces” in 2023 !

The Opportunity


As a data analyst, you will work closely with product managers and business stakeholders to drive the growth of our European business unit. Your mission is to analyze marketplace dynamics, optimize liquidity (balancing supply and demand, improving conversion rates, etc.), and help build a comprehensive understanding of our users and growth opportunities. Your insights will solve complex problems and directly impact our market and users.
You will also design and maintain data tools that support teams across the company, enabling them to make data-driven decisions.
You’ll be part of an international data team of 20, reporting directly to Isaure , Head of Data Analytics focused on Growth Analytics.
To learn more about our data culture, check out our VP of Data & BI's podcast with DataGen.


What You'll Do


Example of projects you will work on :
Serve as the analyst for strategic initiatives by helping to define and track the performance of new business lines.
Deliver advanced analysis and develop data tools to support key business initiatives, such as revenue guarantee programs for car owners.
Create frameworks to analyze the balance between supply and demand in our marketplace, providing actionable recommendations for geo-targeted business opportunities.
Building cross-functional analytics initiatives end to end:
Collaborate with engineers to make sure we structure, collect and process data in an accurate and timely manner.
You'll own your processing pipelines (SQL) and be responsible for tests and documentation.
Conduct exploratory analysis: partner with relevant stakeholders to frame the business problem, deep dive into data to uncover insights, and discuss how to action them
Share your recommendations to cross-functional stakeholders, using meaningful reports and visualizations.
Design KPIs and monitor their performance towards our objectives.Empower the team by building ground truth data sets and evangelizing data tools to your stakeholders.


Our Stack


Snowflake data warehouse, ELT managed with Airflow and dbt, our own Segment-like integrations, BI/visualization tools such as Tableau and Metabase, Python notebooks in Hex.


What You'll Bring


3 to 5 years experience in Data/BI roles in a tech environment.
Background in quantitative fields eg Maths, Statistics, Engineering or Business with very strong analytical skills and a willingness to learn more technical skills.
A strong interest in understanding and improving business performance: you are eager to analyze both external market trends and internal data to assess business drivers, identify opportunities, and provide actionable recommendations that influence strategy and growth.
Strong ability to turn complex data into actionable insights in a fast-paced environment
Strong experience with writing SQL queries, joining large datasets from multiple sources.
Experience with Python or other data-oriented programming languages is a strong plus.
Attention to detail: you like to understand the fine technicalities of things, and build reliable and resilient data models.
Communication: you’re excellent at summarizing any problem and explaining the big picture, both in written and verbal form. You share information proactively.
Fluency in English: you can work in English on a daily basis.
Would be a strong plus:
A prior experience with marketplaces or marketing analytics.
Environmental awareness/interest in mobility: interest in car ownership environmental impact and/or mobility is a strong plus.
👉 If your profile doesn't check all of the above yet, you can still apply, and we’ll let you know if we think this position can be a good fit for you


Why Join Us


🌎 Getaround Europe is a fast-growing startup located in the center of Paris and an office in Oslo. We offer one of the most dynamic and diverse company cultures in town, and give every employee the opportunity to grow and the power to define their impact at Getaround.
🌱 The opportunity to have a positive impact on climate change. Cars are responsible for 17% of carbon emissions. In France, an independent study has shown that each connected car shared on Getaround replaces more than 5 self-owned cars.
🧠 A place to learn and grow with weekly 1 on 1 meetings with your manager, frequent 360° feedback from your teammates, personal objectives to develop your potential, unlimited access to Udemy (learning platform), optional annual training, plus a team wiki that you’ll contribute to improve
💰 Competitive salary based on your level of experience
🌐 An international team and company: our product is live in the US, France, Norway, Germany, Spain, Belgium and Austria.
🏡 A remote friendly policy: this position is based in our Paris office with up to 3 days of remote work per week.
📝 A monthly subsidy to cover part of your work-related expenses at home
🤝 Getaround is committed to equal opportunity. We value and embrace diversity, equity and inclusion of all our Getarounders

We’re extremely proud to be certified one of the “Best Workplaces” in 2023 !

The Opportunity

  • As a data analyst, you will work closely with product managers and business stakeholders to drive the growth of our European business unit. Your mission is to analyze marketplace dynamics, optimize liquidity (balancing supply and demand, improving conversion rates, etc.), and help build a comprehensive understanding of our users and growth opportunities. Your insights will solve complex problems and directly impact our market and users.
  • You will also design and maintain data tools that support teams across the company, enabling them to make data-driven decisions.
  • You’ll be part of an international data team of 20, reporting directly to Isaure , Head of Data Analytics focused on Growth Analytics.
  • To learn more about our data culture, check out our VP of Data & BI's podcast with DataGen.

What You'll Do

  • Example of projects you will work on :
  • Serve as the analyst for strategic initiatives by helping to define and track the performance of new business lines.
  • Deliver advanced analysis and develop data tools to support key business initiatives, such as revenue guarantee programs for car owners.
  • Create frameworks to analyze the balance between supply and demand in our marketplace, providing actionable recommendations for geo-targeted business opportunities.
  • Building cross-functional analytics initiatives end to end:
  • Collaborate with engineers to make sure we structure, collect and process data in an accurate and timely manner.
  • You'll own your processing pipelines (SQL) and be responsible for tests and documentation.
  • Conduct exploratory analysis: partner with relevant stakeholders to frame the business problem, deep dive into data to uncover insights, and discuss how to action them
  • Share your recommendations to cross-functional stakeholders, using meaningful reports and visualizations.
  • Design KPIs and monitor their performance towards our objectives.Empower the team by building ground truth data sets and evangelizing data tools to your stakeholders.

Our Stack

  • Snowflake data warehouse, ELT managed with Airflow and dbt, our own Segment-like integrations, BI/visualization tools such as Tableau and Metabase, Python notebooks in Hex.

What You'll Bring

  • 3 to 5 years experience in Data/BI roles in a tech environment.
  • Background in quantitative fields eg Maths, Statistics, Engineering or Business with very strong analytical skills and a willingness to learn more technical skills.
  • A strong interest in understanding and improving business performance: you are eager to analyze both external market trends and internal data to assess business drivers, identify opportunities, and provide actionable recommendations that influence strategy and growth.
  • Strong ability to turn complex data into actionable insights in a fast-paced environment
  • Strong experience with writing SQL queries, joining large datasets from multiple sources.
  • Experience with Python or other data-oriented programming languages is a strong plus.
  • Attention to detail: you like to understand the fine technicalities of things, and build reliable and resilient data models.
  • Communication: you’re excellent at summarizing any problem and explaining the big picture, both in written and verbal form. You share information proactively.
  • Fluency in English: you can work in English on a daily basis.
  • Would be a strong plus:
  • A prior experience with marketplaces or marketing analytics.
  • Environmental awareness/interest in mobility: interest in car ownership environmental impact and/or mobility is a strong plus.
  • 👉 If your profile doesn't check all of the above yet, you can still apply, and we’ll let you know if we think this position can be a good fit for you

Why Join Us

  • 🌎 Getaround Europe is a fast-growing startup located in the center of Paris and an office in Oslo. We offer one of the most dynamic and diverse company cultures in town, and give every employee the opportunity to grow and the power to define their impact at Getaround.
  • 🌱 The opportunity to have a positive impact on climate change. Cars are responsible for 17% of carbon emissions. In France, an independent study has shown that each connected car shared on Getaround replaces more than 5 self-owned cars.
  • 🧠 A place to learn and grow with weekly 1 on 1 meetings with your manager, frequent 360° feedback from your teammates, personal objectives to develop your potential, unlimited access to Udemy (learning platform), optional annual training, plus a team wiki that you’ll contribute to improve
  • 💰 Competitive salary based on your level of experience
  • 🌐 An international team and company: our product is live in the US, France, Norway, Germany, Spain, Belgium and Austria.
  • 🏡 A remote friendly policy: this position is based in our Paris office with up to 3 days of remote work per week.
  • 📝 A monthly subsidy to cover part of your work-related expenses at home
  • 🤝 Getaround is committed to equal opportunity. We value and embrace diversity, equity and inclusion of all our Getarounders
  • 🗓 Unlimited 30% vouchers for your Getaround bookings
  • 💫 Health insurance

This role entails a deep understanding of the business domain, identifying key performance indicators, and translating complex data into actionable business insights. As a data business partner, you will collaborate closely with various departments across the company. This role combines deep analytical expertise with business knowledge and demands a continuous commitment to learning and adapting. Title: Portfolio Data Analyst
Description:
We offer:




• Unique opportunity to get exposure to the global lending and capital markets business while working with colleagues in London

• Technical language, proprietary environment, and infrastructure training

• Technical and professional on-the job training in securitized products and structured credit

• An introduction to Morgan Stanley and the global financial markets

• Contingent/Leased assignment working onsite at Morgan Stanley

• Contract via 3rd party agency




You will:




• Analyze assets including commercial real estate loans, residential mortgages, auto loans and other cash-flow generating assets

• Provide oversight of ongoing client requests for fundings

• Work with other internal teams to build-out transaction & collateral monitoring systems

• Provide senior management with monthly, quarterly and annual updates on the lending portfolio

• Conduct market and asset level research




You have:




• BSc or MSc in finance or a quantitative field (e.g. finance, economics and engineering)

• 0-3 years of experience. Preferably a background with a financial institution, rating agency or accounting firm

• Excellent data management skills: MS Excel, pivot tables, database management (Access or SQL experience is a plus)

• Strong work ethic, attention to detail, analytical mindset

• Proficient verbal and written communication skills in English




Team profile:




Morgan Stanley FID Deleverage and Lending group (“DLG”) is seeking to hire an analyst to be part of its lending portfolio management platform based in Budapest.

DLG provides asset-backed financing solutions to institutional clients and manages a portfolio backed by a diverse range of assets including consumer loans, residential and commercial mortgages, corporate loans, etc. The asset management team within DLG provides ongoing portfolio management, monitoring and risk oversight, and reports to senior management.




About Morgan Stanley




Morgan Stanley is a global financial services firm and a market leader in investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. Throughout your contingent/leased assignment working onsite at Morgan Stanley, you will be exposed to a truly international and multi-cultural environment that appreciates and respects individuality. Our state-of-the-art offices in the City Centre have been designed to maximize collaboration.

At Morgan Stanley Budapest, we are shaping the future of our global business and contributing to our local community. Our team works across numerous areas, including Technology, Mathematical Modelling, Finance, Risk Management, Operations and Data & Analytics from our new state-of-the-art offices near the Danube and our City Gate office in the heart of the city center.
